result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Spicer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Complete a mental health assestment and follow recommendations. Comply with current counseling at Harvest. Must live with parents unless agent and parents approve change of residence. No overnights at anyone's home unless mother approves. Parents may impose curfew. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR enroll in education program full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week. Obtain high school diploma.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED
Credit granted only if revoked.

Review hearing on July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas J Spicer in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - No position on future req for expungment
Def - Req court hold open decision on req for expungment after completion of probation

BTC: Probation 2 years, sent w/held
90 Days RCJ I&S w/CFTS only if revoked
Enroll in education program - obtain HS diploma/FT employment
No alc/cs
AODA and mental health assessments - follow rec's
Comply with current counseling at Harvest
Must live with parents - unless Agent and parents approve change of residence
No overnights at anyone's home unless mother approves 
Parents may impose curfew
Court costs
Provide DNA - pay fee
Pay outstanding ZCI fees

Firearm warning
Voting prohibition

May petition for expungment after successful completion of probation and counseling, payment of all fees, and no new criminal acts
Will review in 90 days
  Review hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ZCI
Sentencing hearing on April 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, SL.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780) exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
01/09/15 - BOND AMENDED To allow Defendant to attend treatment/services at Harves Counseling. Also to leave the State from Jan 19-21 to attend court in Kentucky. Defendant may attend school at Horlick - must provide schedule to ZCI.
02/13/15 - GPS TO BE REMOVED. Defendant must report to ZCI after every court appearance for UA. 8pm Curfew - unless at work. Follow all rules of home. Must have parents permission when out of home

Defendant Nicholas J Spicer in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Plea to Ct 1 w/out enhancer, DRI Ct 2
Rights given
P - Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt Ct 1 w/out enhancer. DRI Ct 2. PSI ordered. 

Def - Req bond modified to remove GPS
St - No obj once def provides clean test to ZCI
BTC: Motion for bond modification to remove GPS - defendant must report to ZCI after every court appearance for UA. 8pm Curfew - unless at work. Follow all rules of home. Must have parents permission when out of home.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
